That was absolutely ridiculous. If any customer ever buys a product and that product was non-functional from the very start, I'm sorry but NO CUSTOMER should EVER have to pay extra to get what they should've received the first time. All this to say, after we expressed our displeasure with this option, Lisa Williams took it on herself to reach out to the store manager and attempt to get approval to waive the $109 this single instance for the replacement delivery, which was approved. We are thankful to her for going out of her way to help us get what we paid for to start with.The only thing I would say is when presenting the options, at least include reaching out the the store manager for this as an option or make some sort of policy to ensure people who buy your products actually get what they paid for in the initial purchase, without an additional charge just to get it fixed. After the purchase sure, customer is responsible without a warranty... but at least give the customer the opportunity to enjoy your products the way they paid for them to be right out of the box. We love the couch, and Lisa was excellent. We are just upset that the couch arrived not functioning the way correctly, and that we were prompted to pay for an additional discounted delivery fee of $69 to get a replacement for what arrived already non-functioning BEFORE we were informed of the potential one-time waived fee from the store managerI am writing this review before the replacement has arrived, so the quality of the replacement is yet to be determined.
